info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 15 at 3:59PM EDT until August 15 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Morristown TN
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Hamilton, Marion and Sequatchie.
* WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT /500 PM CDT/.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 358 PM EDT /258 PM CDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chattanooga, Soddy-Daisy, Signal Mountain, Walden, Fairmount, Red Bank, Hicks Gap State Park, Lone Oak, Lookout Mountain, Falling Water, North Chickamauga Creek Gorge and Middle Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT /5 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Hamilton, TN; Marion, TN; Sequatchie, TN
